medical_history.chief_complaint: Fatigue, low blood pressure, arthralgia, and myalgia for 1 week.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 week prior to October 13, 2020, after the patient did farm work in the mountains without personal protection. Symptoms included fatigue, low blood pressure, arthralgia, and myalgia. Four days after admission, blood pressure fell dramatically to 84/58 mmHg, jaundice appeared, and renal function deteriorated. The patient's condition worsened on days 2â€“4 of hospitalization, leading to generalized pain without fever and jaundice over the entire body.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Untreated hydronephrosis for 4 years; positive for hepatitis B surface antigen for several decades; chronic anemia indicated by decreased red blood cell count and high free iron levels.
medical_history.family_history: Two family members engaged in farm work underwent antibody testing for leptospirosis, which revealed negative results.
medical_history.social_history: The patient has a farming background and was involved in farm work in the mountains.
